CSS Classes

Buttons

To create a button you need a <button> or an <a> element.

Add 'btn-default' class for a basic clean button.

Add 'btn-primary' class for a basic clean button. btn-primary btn-default-premium btn-primary-premium btn-primary-market btn-default btn-borderless

Add 'btn-large' class for a large button.

You can disable a button by adding a class 'disabled' or by adding an attribute disabled="disabled" (will work nicely with angular forms). disabled link

Whatever you do -

Inputs and textareas

Input fields and textareas don't require any classes, when you add <input> or <textarea> you will receive the styling for these elements:

It can also be a div with class 'input'

This is input type=checkbox and it will also won't be affected

Dropdown

This is the base html for a dropdown:

<div class="dropdown"> <div>Choose Item</div> <ul> <li>Option 1</li> <li>Option 2</li> <li>Option 3</li> </ul> </div>

You can add 'dropdown-large' class to get the bigger version of the dropdown field

You can add 'dropdown-error' to get an error mode of the dropdown

You can add 'dropdown-no-hover' so that dropdown list will not be visible on hover

You can add 'dropdown-open' so that dropdown list will be visible regardless of hover

Choose Item
  • Option 1
  • Option 2
  • Option 3
Dropdown with 'dropdown-error'
  • Second option
  • Third option
  • Fourth option
Overflowing text is supported 123456789

Some text that exlains this component

Icons font

2 ways to use the icons font:

1. Can be added as a class: <i class="wix-svg-font-icons-arrow-down"></i>

2. Can be added via @mixin: @include get-svg-font-icon(<icon-family>, <icon-name>);, for example: @include get-svg-font-icon("wix-svg-font-icons", "wix-svg-font-icons-check");


List of font classes

    wix-svg-font-icons-arrow-left

    wix-svg-font-icons-arrow-top

    wix-svg-font-icons-arrow-right

    wix-svg-font-icons-arrow-down

    wix-svg-font-icons-check

    wix-svg-font-icons-x

    wix-svg-font-icons-plus

    wix-svg-font-icons-info
